alert.note: Alert for Clay; Randolph (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 10:03PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Randolph and southeastern Clay Counties through 1030 PM CDT... At 1002 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lineville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lineville, Ashland, Wedowee, Lake Wedowee, Barfield, Cragford, R.L. Harris Dam, Ofelia and Mellow Valley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for east central Alabama.
